Definition: from {{h947}}; a trampling; treading (trodden) down (under foot).
from the same as {{h950}}; emptiness; void.
from {{h5042}}; a fountain; fountain, spring.
from {{h977}}; select, i.e. best; choice(-st), chosen.
from {{h977}}; select, i.e. well fortified; choice.
or מֶבָּט; from {{h5027}}; something expected, i.e. (abstractly) expectation; expectation.
the same as {{h4005}}; Mibchar, an Israelite; Mibhar.
from {{h982}}; properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance; confidence, hope, sure, trust.
from {{h981}}; a rash utterance (hasty vow); (that which...) uttered (out of).
a variation for {{h4087}}; Madmannah, a place in Palestine; Madmannah.
the same as {{h4087}}; Madmenah, a place in Palestine; Madmenah.
a variation for {{h4080}}; Middin.
the same as {{h4079}}; Midjan, a son of Abraham; also his country and (collectively) his descendants; Midian, Midianite.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4082}}; province.
from {{h1777}}; properly, a judgeship, i.e. jurisdiction; by implication, a district (as ruled by a judge); generally, a region; (× every) province.
from {{h1743}}; a mortar; mortar.
patronymical or patrial from {{h4080}}; a Midjanite or descendant (native) of Midjan; Midianite. Compare {{h4092}}.
feminine from the same as {{h1828}}; a dunghill; dunghill.
from the same as {{h1828}}; dunghill; Madmen, a place in Palestine; Madmen.
from {{h1129}}; built up; Mebunnai, an Israelite; Mebunnai.
also (in plural) feminine (Daniel 11:l5) מִבְצָרָה; from {{h1219}}; a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender; (de-, most) fenced, fortress, (most) strong (hold).
from {{h1082}}; desistance (or rather desolation); comfort self.
from {{h1129}}; a building; frame.
from {{h954}}; (plural) the (male) pudenda; secrets.
from the same as {{h1314}}; fragrant; Mibsam, the name of an Ishmaelite and of an Israelite; Mibsam.
the same as {{h4013}}; Mibtsar, an Idumaean; Mibzar.
from {{h1272}}; a refugee; fugitive.
from {{h1310}}; a cooking hearth; boiling-place.
from the same as {{h1378}}; stiffening; Magbish, an Israelite, or a place in Palestine; Magbish.
from {{h1758}}; a threshing, i.e. (concretely and figuratively) down-trodden people; threshing.
of Persian origin; Medatha, the father of Haman; Hammedatha (including the article).
a variation of {{h4084}}; Midianite.
or מַדַּע; from {{h3045}}; intelligence or consciousness; knowledge, science, thought.
a form of {{h4066}}; discord, strife.
the same as {{h4090}}; Medan, a son of Abraham; Medan.
from {{h1869}}; a treading, i.e. a place for stepping on; (foot-) breadth.
from {{h1875}}; properly, an investigation, i.e. (by implication) a treatise or elaborate compilation; story.
from {{h1856}}; a wound; piercing.
from an unused root meaning to step; properly, a step; by implication, a steep or inaccessible place; stair, steep place.
from {{h4026}} and {{h5739}}; tower of a flock; Migdal-Eder, a place in Palestine; Migdal-eder, tower of the flock.
from {{h4026}} and {{h1408}}; tower of Fortune; Migdal-Gad, a place in Palestine; Migdal-gad.
from {{h4026}} and {{h410}}; tower of God; Migdal-El, a place in Palestine; Migdal-el.

also (in plural) feminine מִגְדָּלָה; from {{h1431}}; a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers; castle, flower, tower. Compare the names following.
from {{h4022}} and {{h410}}; preciousness of God; Magdiel, an Idumaean; Magdiel.
or מִגְדֹּל; probably of Egyptian origin; Migdol, a place in Egypt; Migdol, tower.
(Zechariah {{h12}}) or מְגִדּוֹ; from {{h1413}}; rendezvous; Megiddon or Megiddo, a place in Palestine; Megiddo, Megiddon.
from an unused root probably meaning to be eminent; properly, a distinguished thing; hence something valuable, as a product or fruit; pleasant, precious fruit (thing).
from the same as {{h1389}}; a cap (as hemispherical); bonnet.
from {{h1379}}; a border; end.
from an unused root meaning to reap; a sickle; sickle.
from {{h1556}}; a roll; roll, volume.
from the same as {{h4022}}; preciousness, i.e. a gem; precious thing, present.
from {{h1463}}; Magog, a son of Japheth; also a barbarous northern region; Magog.
or (Lamentations 2:22) מָגוּר; from {{h1481}} in the sense of fearing; a fright (objective or subjective); fear, terror. Compare {{h4036}}.
or מָגֻר; from {{h1481}} in the sense of lodging; a temporary abode; by extension, a permanent residence; dwelling, pilgrimage, where sojourn, be a stranger. Compare {{h4032}}.
feminine of {{h4032}}; affright; fear.
feminine of {{h4032}} or of {{h4033}}; a fright; also a granary; barn, fear.
from {{h4032}} and {{h5439}} with the preposition inserted; affright from around; Magor-mis-Sabib, a symbolic name of Pashur; Magormissabib.
from {{h1504}}; a cutting implement, i.e. a blade; axe.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4048}}; to overthrow; destroy.
a primitive root; to yield up; intensively, to precipitate; cast down, terror.
from {{h1605}}; reproof (i.e. curse); rebuke.
from {{h4042}}; a covering (in a bad sense), i.e. blindness or obduracy; sorrow. See also {{h4043}}.
apparently from {{h1479}} or {{h5062}} and {{h6211}}; exterminator of (the) moth; Magpiash, an Israelite; Magpiash.
from {{h5062}}; a pestilence; by analogy, defeat; (× be) plague(-d), slaughter, stroke.
from the same as {{h1571}}; properly, accumulation, i.e. impulse or direction; sup up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4039}}; roll.

also (in plural) feminine מְגִנָּה; from {{h1598}}; a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile; × armed, buckler, defence, ruler,   scale, shield.
a denominative from {{h4043}}; properly, to shield; encompass with; figuratively, to rescue, to hand safely over (i.e. surrender); deliver.
a primitive root; properly, to stretch; by implication, to measure (as if by stretching a line); figuratively, to be extended; measure, mete, stretch self.
from {{h5074}}; flight; be gone.
(Aramaic) from {{h1684}}; a sacrificial altar; altar.
from {{h1696}} in the sense of driving; a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs); desert, south, speech, wilderness.

also (in plural) feminine (Ezekiel 27:28) מִגְרָשָׁה; from {{h1644}}; a suburb (i.e. open country whither flocks are driven from pasture); hence, the area around a building, or the margin of the sea; cast out, suburb.
or מֵד; from {{h4058}}; properly, extent, i.e. height; also a measure; by implication, a vesture (as measured); also a carpet; armour, clothes, garment, judgment, measure, raiment, stature.
from {{h1639}}; a ledge or offset; narrowed rest.
from {{h1640}}; something thrown off (by the spade), i.e. a clod; clod.
from {{h1641}}; a saw; axe, saw.
from {{h4048}}; precipice; Migron, a place in Palestine; Migron.

or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how?why?when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why.
or מַדֻּעַ; from {{h4100}} and the passive participle of {{h3045}}; what (is) known?; i.e. (by implication) (adverbially) why?; how, wherefore, why.
the same as {{h4067}}; Madon, a place in Palestine; Madon.
from an unused root meaning to stretch; properly, extent, i.e. measure; by implication, a dress (as measured); garment.
perhaps from the equivalent of {{h1722}}; goldmaking, i.e. exactness; golden city.
(Aramaic) or מִנְדָּה; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h4060}}; tribute in money; toll, tribute.

feminine of {{h4055}}; properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured); garment, measure(-ing, meteyard, piece, size, (great) stature, tribute, wide.
from the same as {{h4063}}; extensiveness, i.e. height; stature.
from {{h1777}}; a contest or quarrel; brawling, contention(-ous), discord, strife. Compare {{h4079}}, {{h4090}}.
from {{h5080}}; seduction; cause of banishment.
from {{h1738}}; sickness; disease.
of foreign derivation; Madai, a country of central Asia; Madai, Medes, Media.
patrial from {{h4074}}; a Madian or native of Madai; Mede.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4074}}; Mede(-s).
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4075}}; Median.
(Aramaic) or מְדֹר; (Aramaic), or מְדָר; (Aramaic), from {{h1753}}; a dwelling; dwelling.
or מְדֻרָה; from {{h1752}} in the sense of accumulation; a pile of fuel; pile (for fire).
from {{h1760}}; overthrow; ruin.
from {{h1765}}; a push, i.e. ruin; overthrow.
from {{h4100}} and {{h1767}}; what (is) enough, i.e. sufficiently; sufficiently.
a variation for {{h4066}}; brawling, contention(-ous).
